title.value: Neural network prediction of the effect of thermomechanical controlled processing on mechanical properties
title.justification: The title of the paper is clearly mentioned at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Neural network prediction of the effect of thermomechanical controlled processing on mechanical properties

extractions.description: The paper explores the use of artificial neural network methods to predict mechanical properties such as lower yield strength and ultimate tensile strength of microalloyed steels. By employing feature engineering and SHAP values, the study aims to predict the mechanical properties derived from chemical composition and thermomechanical processing history, potentially reducing the need for costly testing.

type.justification: The paper primarily involves empirical research by using datasets to train and evaluate neural network models for prediction of mechanical properties.
type.quote: Such models are primarily empirical, developed through experimental studies, with authors frequently proposing new equations or equation modifications to account for the addition of new alloying elements.

name.justification: The paper focuses on predicting mechanical properties in the context of materials science, particularly thermomechanical processing of microalloyed steels.
name.quote: ...there is a notable dearth of studies specifically addressing the use of these methods for the Direct Strip Processing Center (DSPC) route...

name.justification: The study employs neural network models to predict mechanical properties from alloy composition and thermomechanical processing inputs.
name.quote: This paper provides an artificial neural network methodology to predict lower yield strength (LYS) and ultimate tensile strength (UTS).

name.justification: Thermomechanical processing is a core topic of the paper, focusing on how it affects the mechanical properties of steel.
name.quote: Neural network prediction of the effect of thermomechanical controlled processing on mechanical properties

name.justification: The model is specified in the paper as the primary method for predicting mechanical properties.
name.quote: Given various non-linear and complex mechanisms contributing to the strengthening via thermomechanical processing (Tamura, Sekine, & Tanaka, 2013), ANN has been a successful method to model these processes.

is_contributed.justification: The neural network model is used for prediction purposes but is not a novel contribution of the paper itself.
is_contributed.quote: In the existing body of literature utilizing NN methods, there is a noteworthy absence of efforts to interpret and explain the models, based on our current knowledge. This work aims to produce a suitable model for predicting UTS and LYS at a reasonable level of accuracy...

is_executed.justification: The paper details implementation using ANN for prediction and mentions specific execution frameworks such as PyTorch.
is_executed.quote: The modeling was performed using the open-source Python library PyTorch (Paszke et al., 2019).

is_compared.justification: ANN models are compared in terms of performance metrics such as MSE and PAM in the results section.
is_compared.quote: The performance of the selected neural network models for UTS and LYS for the test data is shown...

referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference discusses artificial neural networks as mentioned in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Graupe, D. (2013). Principles of artificial neural networks: vol. 7, World Scientific.

name.value: 50 and 60 Ksi Nb-based HSLA data from the DSPC rolling mill of Algoma Steel Inc
name.justification: The dataset used in the study is explicitly mentioned.
name.quote: This study uses 50 and 60 Ksi Nb-based HSLA data from the DSPC rolling mill of Algoma Steel Inc (Ontario, Canada).

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific referenced paper provided for this dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: This study uses 50 and 60 Ksi Nb-based HSLA data from the DSPC rolling mill of Algoma Steel Inc (Ontario, Canada).

name.justification: PyTorch is explicitly mentioned as the deep learning library used to implement the model in the study.
name.quote: The modeling was performed using the open-source Python library PyTorch (Paszke et al., 2019).

referenced_paper_title.value: PyTorch: An imperative style, high-performance deep learning library
referenced_paper_title.justification: The authors reference the paper discussing PyTorch as the library used.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Paszke, A., Gross, S., Massa, F., Lerer, A., Bradbury, J., Chanan, G., et al. (2019). Pytorch: An imperative style, high-performance deep learning library. In Advances in neural information processing systems: vol. 32.
